item.title: Vim shortcuts
item.description: Cut/copy and paste using visual selection Visual selection is a common feature in applications, but Vim’s visual selection has several benefits. To cut-and-paste or copy-and-paste: Position the cursor at the beginning of the text you want to cut/copy. Press v to begin character-based visual selection, or V to select whole lines, or Ctrl-v or Ctrl-q to select a block. Move the cursor to the end of the text to be cut/copied.
